page.title: 16SHOPS IN PETTS WOOD
page.content: The first {shops} in {Petts Wood} were built on the north east side of Station Square in 1928. Nelsons newsagents, Hammetts the butchers, Lloyds Bank and Bilham's the fishmongers still stand today. Mr.Bilham the fishmonger in the pre war days sent one of his sons out on a bicycle to take orders in the morning and the fish was delivered by horse and cart to the housewives in time to be cooked for lunch.In 1983 {Safeway} supermarket was built on the site of the {Embassy cinema}. It is now the busiest shop in Petts Wood. Safeway sells fruit, vegetables, drinks, meat, sweets, frozen foods, books, biscuits, bathroom goods, cheeses and pet food. Many small specialist food shops have therefore gone out of business. Now the majority of shops sell shoes, toys, flowers, or stationery.
